thread.title: Genocea Biosciences Shares Dive as Vaccine Candidate Misses Goals
thread.title_full: Genocea Biosciences Shares Dive as Vaccine Candidate Misses Goals

author: morningstar.com
title: Genocea Biosciences Shares Dive as Vaccine Candidate Misses Goals
text:
Genocea Biosciences Inc. suspended development of its experimental pneumococcus vaccine after the treatment failed to show statistically significant results in a phase 2a study, missing primary study targets.
Shares of the Cambridge, Mass., drug developer fell 29% to $5.15 in recent premarket trading.
Genocea said that pending further review of the data and potential paths forward, it plans to turn its focus to its immunotherapy treatment for genital herpes—known as GEN-003—which also is in phase 2 development.
In a study of 98 healthy adults Genocea's vaccine candidate—GEN-004—reduced the pneumococcal colonization rate by measured by microbiological culture, by between 22% and 25% versus a placebo and reduced the presence of pneumococcal DNA by between 18% and 36%.
Genocea Chief Executive Chip Clark said in prepared remarks Monday that the company believes "it is possible that future trials would require a change in some combination of dose, adjuvant or trial population to confirm any effect."
Pneumococcal disease is caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae bacteria and can lead to a range of illnesses including pneumonia, ear infections, sinus infections, meningitis and bloodstream infections, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention website.
Write to Tess Stynes at tess.stynes@wsj.com

 19, 2015 09:35 ET (13:35
